title: BACnetClientReadRange (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK PUBLIC FINAL BACnetClientReadRange EXTENDS
BACnetClientBase
Common Behaviour Model conform (ETrigA) FB to execute a Read-Range-Reqeust in the BACnet-Network.
Ifexecution completed successfully and xDone is TRUE, result is filled with valid data,
in any other case the data in result are not valid.

rows.Name: xExecute
rows.Comment: Rising edge: Starts defined operationFALSE: Resets the defined operation after ready condition was reached

rows:
Max. operating time for executing
[Âµs], 0: No operating time limit

rows.Name: dwTargetDeviceNumber
rows.Comment:
The device number of the targeted device in the BACnet-
Network.

rows:
Optional: The device address of the targeted device in the BACnet-Network. If
an adress is given the given device number is ignored.

rows.Name: eStatus
rows.Comment: If an error occured, the error state.

rows:
If an error occured (this means eStatus <> BACNET_STATUS_OK), whereas the sent BACnet-Request was answered
with an specific error information, the latter is contained in this structure.

The State in which the FB is during execution:0: No execution, resetted state1: Searching for the Target-Device and a valid address for it2: Sending the BACnet-Request into the network3: Waiting for the answer (if there is one) to the BACnet-Request made in 24: Finishing the call, setting of the output variables

rows.Name: objType
rows.Comment:
The type of the object under the targeted device to read the
range from.

rows:
The instance number of the object under the targeted device
to read the range from.

The property ID of the property of the object under the
targeted device to read the range from.
The type of the range to be read.
The type dependant range to be read.

Optional: The Index of the element of the property read. Only use for constant array properties.
Otherwise use index -1 or leave empty.

rows.Name: result
rows.Comment:
If the BACnet-Request succeeded (xDone is TRUE and no error occured (xError is FALSE)), this
variable holds the contents of the read property. Use the helper functions GetRealFromContents, Getâ¦
to evaluate its value (for simple property types). Otherwise be sure to correctly interpretate the
contents data.
